#SP00KY B00GIE ###First-person horror game created using Unreal Game Engine. ###Team: Roland Zeng (@rzeng95) Helen Liang (@hliang93) Kevin Zuo (@thessiah) Justin Hou (@justinyhou) ###About: We created Spooky Boogie as part of CS188 - Virtual Reality Game Development. Over the course of 10 weeks, we learned how to use Unreal Game Engine to create a game playable on the [Oculus Rift](https://www.oculus.com/en-us/). We used Blueprints and Unreal's experimental Environment Query System to create a realistic interactive environment and spooky AI ghosties. ###Demo Video: [Oculus Playthrough](https://www.dropbox.com/s/s6asyw2db2f88qt/final1.1.wmv?dl=0) ###Important: We used Unreal Engine v4.7.6. Future versions may or may not affect the performance of this game. ###Controls: WASD : Move SPACE: Jump E: Pick up keys or open doors. F: Toggle Flashlight. Flashlight slowly drains and charges when turned off. R-CLICK: Toggle Camera L-Click: Fire Camera - 10 second cooldown. Any spooky ghosts hit by camera flash are briefly stunned. ###In-Game and AI Screenshots:
